snippet.textDisplay: *sonic presses maria button*
snippet.textOriginal: *sonic presses maria button*

snippet.textDisplay: Just like Maria, huh?
snippet.textOriginal: Just like Maria, huh?

snippet.textDisplay: That was my favorite scene in SMBZ, and to me the moment where it started to get really good.
snippet.textOriginal: That was my favorite scene in SMBZ, and to me the moment where it started to get really good.

snippet.textDisplay: RIP the little girl with the chalk. I still can't believe the game actually had the balls to kill her off.
snippet.textOriginal: RIP the little girl with the chalk. I still can't believe the game actually had the balls to kill her off.

snippet.textDisplay: @Admiral Craymen Oh God, that's true. I'm starting to remember all the lovable characters that lived there now, it's really fucking sad.
snippet.textOriginal: @Admiral Craymen Oh God, that's true. I'm starting to remember all the lovable characters that lived there now, it's really fucking sad.

snippet.textDisplay: I don't think the stray dog survived, either. It's been years since I played. I wish you could take him with you.
snippet.textOriginal: I don't think the stray dog survived, either. It's been years since I played. I wish you could take him with you.

snippet.textDisplay: We're getting Shenmue 3. Anything is possible. Let's bring back Skies of Arcadia.
snippet.textOriginal: We're getting Shenmue 3. Anything is possible. Let's bring back Skies of Arcadia.

snippet.textDisplay: Awesome memories...
snippet.textOriginal: Awesome memories...

snippet.textDisplay: Cold night. Emotional streets and sad poverty. Strong melting pot. Crossworld with steampunk legacy and shinning asia. We want step inside that world even if Ramirez kill us.
snippet.textOriginal: Cold night. Emotional streets and sad poverty. Strong melting pot. Crossworld with steampunk legacy and shinning asia. We want step inside that world even if Ramirez kill us.

snippet.textDisplay: Best atmosphere of any game I've ever played, never been drawn in quite like this.
snippet.textOriginal: Best atmosphere of any game I've ever played, never been drawn in quite like this.

snippet.textDisplay: This soundtrack caused me to buy and complete the game, which I otherwise might never have heard of.
snippet.textOriginal: This soundtrack caused me to buy and complete the game, which I otherwise might never have heard of.

snippet.textDisplay: Love Love Love this game.  Good non-obvious track choice.  This is a really good moody track. Gave me a great feel for the feeling of oppression and hopelessness that hangs around Lower Valua.
snippet.textOriginal: Love Love Love this game.  Good non-obvious track choice.  This is a really good moody track. Gave me a great feel for the feeling of oppression and hopelessness that hangs around Lower Valua.

snippet.textDisplay: if the more superficial people could just look past the Dreamcast graphics. i bet this would have been so much more well known and popular outside the minority that has actually experienced the game. one of the most memorable rpg games of all time for me.. since this was the first game to introduce me to the genre itself. maybe it's time to see if my old GC still works :D
snippet.textOriginal: if the more superficial people could just look past the Dreamcast graphics. i bet this would have been so much more well known and popular outside the minority that has actually experienced the game. one of the most memorable rpg games of all time for me.. since this was the first game to introduce me to the genre itself. maybe it's time to see if my old GC still works :D

snippet.textDisplay: I think it was at this point in the game where the prospect of being in way over my head began to set in. Valua City was the point of no return.
snippet.textOriginal: I think it was at this point in the game where the prospect of being in way over my head began to set in. Valua City was the point of no return.

snippet.textDisplay: While this track sometimes moves me to tears (all I can think about is that little girl wondering what "white bread" is like, because all she's ever eaten is hard, black bread.), I don't really think it's all that nice to listen to. It's perfect for it's setting, and did it'd job better then I thought possible... but I don't like it. Probably because it represents poverty so strongly to me.
snippet.textOriginal: While this track sometimes moves me to tears (all I can think about is that little girl wondering what "white bread" is like, because all she's ever eaten is hard, black bread.), I don't really think it's all that nice to listen to. It's perfect for it's setting, and did it'd job better then I thought possible... but I don't like it. Probably because it represents poverty so strongly to me.

snippet.textDisplay: I know I'm korny...but I'm a hardcore Skies of Arcadia fan...I rmbr this city and this music fits the scenery so well...you feel the lost hope and the sadness in it....beautifuly put together game that I think still rivals some of the new RPG's today
